intro: Sayeria aberrans, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and thorny stems. The plant produces small, greenish fruits that are typically consumed by birds and other wildlife. It is well adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils with limited water availability. Sayeria aberrans plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat in its native ecosystems.
